Class zReportController

java.lang.Object
zReportController
public class zReportController extends Object
Controller for the Z-report page.

This screen displays the daily totals for daily sales, tax, numver of daily customers, orders, number of new unique customers for the current day.

When the Z-report is generated on action through a button it also resets the daily totals back to 0 for the next coming day. It also prevents more than one z-report per day from being generated.

All data is queried from the daily_total table and order table.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()

    • updateDailyTotalForToday

      public void updateDailyTotalForToday()
      Updates the daily_total table to reflect the current daily totals.

      Runs an aggregate query over the order table for the current day.

      It calculates total sales, estimated tax, number of new unique customers, total orders, number of customers in total.

      If the query fails it prints the stack trace.

    • generateZReport

      public void generateZReport()
      Handles the generate z report button and gives it functionality.

      Checks to see if the z-report was generated toay or not, if it was generated it disables the button, if not it sets all the daily totals to 0. It then updates the daily totals table "last_z_report" to get the current timestamp. It then reloads the totals on the UI and disables the button.

      If the query has a database error it prints an error to the console.

    • loadTotals

      public void loadTotals()
      Loads the current totals from daily_total and writes them to their respective labels.

      It reads daily_sales, daily_tax, new_customers, order_total, and customer_total.

      If there is no data in daily_total, it sets the respective labels to 0 by default. If there is a database error then it prints the error and keeps the UI as is.

    • checkZReportButton

      public void checkZReportButton()
      Disables the generate z report button if the z-report has already been generated for the day.

      Checks the table daily_total and looks at last_z_report to see if the timestamp was today. If it was then it disables the generate z report button.

      If the query fails, the stack trace is pritned and button is not affected.

    • handleBack

      public void handleBack()
      Handles the back button.

      Loads managerMenu.fxml and changes the current Stage to show the manager menub screen.

      If the FXML cannot be loaded, the exception stack trace is printed and scene stays the same.
